oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. William Burton to his parents and his wife Becky
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. William Burton, 2nd Ky. Cav., USA wrote to his parents from a Federal camp of 14,000 troops near Elizabethtown, Ky. Burton wrote that he would be paid $14 per month and would receive boots, a horse, pistol and sword before long. They drilled well and ate well. He asked his father to watch out for his family. The final page is to his wife and spoke of his longing to see her and his children, and included a few fond and funny lines to make his son laugh.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
